work.summary: Teaching assistant for CSE 5610 (Large Language Models).

courses.name: Freiwald research program
courses.description: In high dimensional subsystem of bipartite qbits, with high probability, a random selected state is almost maximally entangled.

courses.name: CSE 559A (Computer vision)
courses.description: An introduction to computer vision, covering Vision Transformers, Object Detection, and Segmentation.

courses.name: Nath 401 (Honors Seminar)
courses.description: This is the prerequisite for the Freiwald research program in the summer of 2025.

courses.name: Math 416 (Complex functions)
courses.description: An introduction to complex functions, covering complex analysis, complex integration, and complex differential equations. With focus on Cauchy's integral formula, singularities, and residue theorem.

courses.name: Math 4121 (Lebesgue integration)
courses.description: An introduction to Lebesgue integration, covering Lebesgue measure, Measure theory

courses.name: CSE 347 (Analysis of Algorithms)
courses.description: An introduction to analysis of algorithms, covering some basic techniques for analyzing algorithms, and introduce greedy algorithms, dynamic programming.

courses.name: CSE 442T (Cryptography)
courses.description: An introduction to cryptography, covering public-key cryptography, authentication, and digital signature.

courses.name: Jap 213D (Japanese Language Level 2 semester 1)
courses.description: An intermediate level Japanese language course, covering basic grammar, vocabulary, and conversation.

courses.name: Math 4111 (Real analysis)
courses.description: An introduction to real analysis, covering real numbers, basic topology

courses.name: Intensive training in Hand drawing illustration
courses.description: As the trend of AI-generated images, I started to reinforce my hand drawing skills over the summer and started to learn tempera painting. For me that's actually easier than digital drawing since you can craft the color and texture you want directly by hand mixing the pigment and choose the brush you want instead of using a digital tool bending those rules of light.

courses.name: Antro 160B (Cultural Anthropology)
courses.description: An introduction to cultural anthropology, covering cultural relativism, cultural relativism, and cultural relativism.

courses.name: CSE 514A (Data Mining)
courses.description: An introduction to data mining, covering supervised learning, data cleaning and preprocessing.

courses.name: Econ 4011 (Intermediate Microeconomics)
courses.description: An introduction to intermediate microeconomics, covering game theory, market equilibrium, and market equilibrium.

courses.name: Jap 104D (Japanese Language Level 1 semester 2)
courses.description: An introduction to Japanese language, covering basic grammar, vocabulary, and conversation.

courses.name: Math 429 (Linear Algebra)
courses.description: An introduction to linear algebra, covering vector space, linear transformation, Jacobian matrix, Adjoint matrix, and Operator theory.

courses.name: CSE 546T (Computational Geometry)
courses.description: An introduction to computational geometry, covering lower-dimensional geometry, convex hull, Voronoi diagram, and Delaunay triangulation with other open problems.

courses.name: Bio 2970 (Principles of Biology II)
courses.description: An introduction to principles of biology, covering genetics, evolution, and cell biology.

courses.name: Econ 1011 (Introduction to Microeconomics)
courses.description: An introduction to microeconomics, covering supply and demand, market equilibrium. Easy course for those who are not interested in economics.

courses.name: ESE 417 (Machine Learning)
courses.description: An introduction to machine learning, covering perceptron, decision tree, support vector machine, random forest, and neural network.

courses.name: Jap 103D (Japanese Language Level 1 semester 1)
courses.description: An introduction to Japanese language, covering basic grammar, vocabulary, and conversation.

courses.name: Jap 226C (Japanese Culture)
courses.description: An introduction to Japanese culture, covering Japanese history, Japanese literature, and Japanese art.

courses.name: Math 310W (Introduction to Higher Mathematics, writing intensive)
courses.description: An introduction to higher mathematics, covering introductory level of number theory, real analysis, complex analysis, and set theory.

courses.name: CSE 330 (Rapid Prototype Development)
courses.description: An intermediate level of web development, covering full-stack development via React, Node.js, PHP, and MySQL.

courses.name: Math 493, now SDS 493 (Probability Theory)
courses.description: An intermediate level of probability theory, from the basic lemmas to the advanced theorems.

courses.name: Bio 2960 (Principles of Biology I)
courses.description: An introduction to principles of biology,  concentrate on molecules and cells, biochemical processes, and the transfer of information from the genetic material to working proteins, commonly known as the central dogma of biology.

courses.name: Chem 106 & Chem 132 (General Chemistry II)
courses.description: An introduction to general chemistry, covering chemical bonding, chemical reactions, and chemical properties. Also, an introduction to inorganic chemistry and organic chemistry.

courses.name: Math 3200, now SDS 3200 (Introduction to Statistics)
courses.description: An introduction to statistics, covering probability theory, R language, hypothesis testing, and data visualization.

courses.name: Phil 125C (Great Philosophers)
courses.description: An introduction to philosophy, covering from the Socrates, Plato, and Aristotle to the pre-modern philosophy of Kant, Hegel, and Nietzsche.

courses.name: IBM Full Stack Software Developer
courses.description: An introduction to full stack software development, covering the basic concepts of full stack software development from IBM.

courses.name: DeepLearning.AI TensorFlow Developer
courses.description: An introduction to deep learning, covering the basic concepts of deep learning, TensorFlow, and machine learning.

courses.name: Google Data Analytics
courses.description: An introduction to data analytics, covering the basic concepts of data analytics, Google, SQL, R, and Python.

courses.name: Chem 105 (General Chemistry I)
courses.description: An introduction to general chemistry, covering chemical bonding, chemical reactions, and chemical properties. Also, an introduction to inorganic chemistry and organic chemistry.

courses.name: CSE 247 (Algorithms)
courses.description: An introduction to algorithms, covering sorting, searching, graph algorithms.

courses.name: CWP 118 (College Writing Program)
courses.description: An introduction to college writing, covering the techniques of writing academic papers. How to check facts and references.

courses.name: FYP 120A (Psychology, neuroscience, and Philosophy intro I)
courses.description: A first year seminar course for PNP program, covering the basic concepts of psychology, neuroscience, and philosophy.

courses.name: Math 233 (Calculus III)
courses.description: An introduction to multivariable calculus, covering vector calculus, line integral, surface integral, divergence theorem, and Stokes' theorem.

courses.name: Intensive training in Digital Illustration
courses.description: As the end of high school, I started to learn digital illustration via Procreate and Photoshop.

courses.name: General Programming
courses.description: I learned general programming skills in high school, and algorithms in competitive programming.

courses.name: Game Development
courses.description: This is the time when I started to learn game development, and I built a few game fragments with my friends via Unity and Blender.

presentations.description: An introduction to non-commutative probability theory and its applications.

presentations.description: An introduction to information theory and Shannon entropy.

portfolio.name: WashU Chinese Geeks Club
description-keys: Built a club for Chinese students in WashU to share their interests and experiences regarding computer science and career development.
Organized events and activities to promote students engage in learning algorithms via leetcode and enhance their interview skills.
Hosted a series of events to share experiences about course selection and academic planning in learning computer science and mathematics in WashU.

portfolio.name: SophiasPath
description-keys: Built an interactive website for delivering stories and content about philosophers.
Utilized Django backend with Django REST Framework for blog content delivery.
Deployed scalable services using Docker and reverse proxy tools.

portfolio.name: Graphical Applets for Computational Geometry Algorithms
description-keys: Developed graphical applets using JavaScript to visualize computational geometry algorithms.

portfolio.name: NoteNextra (Notechondria)
description-keys: Built a memory archive with LLM to retrieve notes and provide utilities for personal interest.
Discontinued now but still updating notes in notenetra.trance-0.com

portfolio.name: Web Development & Personal Website
description-keys: Built a website containing learning material in computer science and shared personal interests at www.trance-0.com.
Created posts about algorithms and experiences in computer science.
Built VPN using V2ray.

portfolio.name: Cookistry
description-keys: Built a full-stack app for sharing standardized recipes in Python with PostgreSQL using Django Framework.
Designed the app mechanism and UI.
Adapted by WashU cooking club for sharing recipes.
Enabled customized cooking experience with preferred units and accurate time measures.

portfolio.name: Using Machine Learning to Analyze Apartheid in South Africa
description-keys: Provided technical support in a team using Python, TensorFlow, and GPT-3 to construct models analyzing Apartheid in South Africa and Namibia from the Bohr era to the end of segregation.

portfolio.name: TimeBlocks
description-keys: Developed an app to help users enhance concentration and relax scientifically by recording concentration time and finding optimal work-relax cycles.
Features include to-do list management, distraction detection, and personalized reports.
Built independently using Unity and SQL database on VPS.

portfolio.name: Gray-75
description-keys: Initiated a demo project for a first-person puzzle-solving game about Alzheimer's disease.
Led a team, designed scenes, implemented gameplay with Unity and Blender, and provided long-term support for junior developers.

portfolio.name: Robot Open Autonomous Racing (ROAR)
portfolio.organization: UC-Berkeley FHL Vive Center for Enhanced Reality
description-keys: Participated in an autonomous car racing program.
Trained AI agents to drive cars in simulation.
Tuned reward/punishment parameters.
Led a team to improve performance.
Provided technical support and mentorship to new members.
